document.discussion_title: Analysts Set Wendy’s Co. (NASDAQ:WEN) Target Price at $12.93
document.topic_text: Tweet Wendy’s Co. (NASDAQ:WEN) has been given a consensus rating of “Hold” by the seventeen analysts that are currently covering the stock. Two equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell recommendation, seven have assigned a hold recommendation and eight have assigned a buy recommendation to the company. The average 12-month target price among brokerages that have updated their coverage on the stock in the last year is $12.93. Several equities analysts have recently issued reports on the stock. RBC Capital Markets lowered shares of Wendy’s from an “outperform” rating to a “sector perform” rating and lowered their target price for the company from $12.00 to $11.00 in a report on Tuesday, August 2nd. Vetr upgraded shares of Wendy’s from a “buy” rating to a “strong-buy” rating and set a $12.34 target price for the company in a report on Monday, May 2nd. Sanford C. Bernstein assumed coverage on shares of Wendy’s in a report on Thursday, May 26th. They set a “market perform” rating for the company. Royal Bank Of Canada lowered shares of Wendy’s from an “outperform” rating to a “sector perform” rating and lowered their target price for the company from $12.00 to $11.00 in a report on Tuesday, August 2nd. Finally, Zacks Investment Research lowered shares of Wendy’s from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating in a report on Wednesday, July 13th. Shares of Wendy’s ( NASDAQ:WEN ) opened at 9.96 on Friday. The stock has a market cap of $2.60 billion and a P/E ratio of 19.19. The firm’s 50 day moving average price is $9.81 and its 200 day moving average price is $10.15. Wendy’s has a 52-week low of $8.43 and a 52-week high of $11.38. Wendy’s (NASDAQ:WEN) last released its earnings results on Wednesday, August 10th. The company reported $0.10 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters’ consensus estimate of $0.09 by $0.01. The business had revenue of $382.70 million for the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $366.92 million. During the same quarter in the previous year, the business posted $0.08 earnings per share. Wendy’s’s revenue for the quarter was down 21.8% on a year-over-year basis. On average, analysts expect that Wendy’s will post $0.40 EPS for the current year. The business also recently announced a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Thursday, September 15th. Shareholders of record on Thursday, September 1st will be given a $0.06 dividend. This represents a $0.24 dividend on an annualized basis and a yield of 2.41%. The ex-dividend date is Tuesday, August 30th. The Wendy’s Company is the parent company of its subsidiary holding company Wendy’s Restaurants, LLC (Wendy’s Restaurants). Wendy’s Restaurants is the parent company of Wendy’s International, LLC (Wendy’s), which is the owner and franchisor of the Wendy’s restaurant system in the United States. Wendy’s is the restaurant company specializing in the hamburger sandwich segment. Wendy's Co. Wendy's Co.
